column4: Hi can anyone in here help me, I have an ATI x850 and just installed xorg-driver-fglx and now when i run glxinfo it says that direct render is off. How can I turn it back on?
open a console & type 'lsmod' & look if you find fglry among the list...
good. now open your xorg.conf (etc/X11/xorg.conf) and look for the section "Device"...It should say something about ATI... (if you have a ati card, that is...)
In this section "Device" the second line should be 'driver'
Is the 'driver' set to 'fglrx' there?
Stupid question, but have you restarted your system after you installed the fglrx-drivers?
Do you still have that xorg.conf file open?
Scroll down to its ending
Is there something like " Option "Composite" "false" "
If not, try to add the following line(s) to your xorg.conf at its end:
Section "Extensions"
Option "Composite" "false"
EndSection
Then put the three lines that I just posted there
And restart your X-Server
Good luck
